abstract: Google chose to abandon the controversial plan after the Justice Department said it would file an antitrust suit to block it. Yahoo said it would have preferred to defend the deal in court.
snippet: Google chose to abandon the controversial plan after the Justice Department said it would file an antitrust suit to block it. Yahoo said it would have preferred to defend the deal in court.
lead_paragraph: MOUNTAIN VIEW, Calif.  A day after Google walked away from an advertising partnership with Yahoo, Eric E. Schmidt, the chief executive of Google, said he believed that the companies would have been successful if they had chosen to defend the deal in court.

headline.main: Google and Yahoo Say Deal Would Have Survived a Suit
headline.print_headline: Google and Yahoo Say Deal Would Have Survived a Suit

abstract: A day after Google walked away from an advertising partnership with Yahoo, Eric E. Schmidt, the chief executive of Google, said he believed that the companies would have been successful if they had chosen to defend the deal in court, The New York Times’s Miguel Helft reported.
lead_paragraph: A day after Google walked away from an advertising partnership with Yahoo, Eric E. Schmidt, the chief executive of Google, said he believed that the companies would have been successful if they had chosen to defend the deal in court, The New York Times’s Miguel Helft reported.

headline.main: Google and Yahoo Say Deal Would Have Survived a Suit
